explanation: The original line that checks if the count of quotes is odd (cnt%2==1) is incorrect because it replaces commas inside the quoted sections as well (which is not intended). To fix this, I changed it to check if the count of quotes is even instead (cnt%2==0), ensuring that we only replace commas outside the enclosed quotes. This thought process was inspired by the idea that we need to differentiate between enclosed and non-enclosed characters.
